answers.answer: Ive done quite a few and they are no big deal. My little man always does great. Make sure you eat before going in and drink plenty of water.

I do them 3 times a week because of my preeclampsia, you just relax with the fetal heartrate and tomo(contraction) monitor on you for a while. I always ask for juice and crackers or cookies while I'm there :)
thanks for the advice ladies :) im excited because ill get to see her before she comes out of my tummy but i would rather have her here in my arms! <3

They just make sure baby is doing well. They calculate it based on how far along you.are. They want to see the heart rate increase when babe moves and they also monitoe contractions if you are having any at the time and what babes heart beat does. They can tell by your babes heartbeat of they are atill thriving inside.

I have a week of 2 hr sessions to monitor baby.  Its not that bad you just sit there and press buttons when baby moves to check stress n contractions.  its actually quite peaceful knowing baby is ok and nothibg is wrong
I had 3 last week and have another one on Friday. I'll be 41 weeks tmrw

I had one monday while I was being checked for hypertension, it was hilarious because the nurse kept having to run back in because with the way baby is positioned every time he kicked he would kick the monitor off and it would lose his heartbeat, I knew he was fine was but the nurse was getting frantic, eventually she just asked me to hold the monitor to wherever he was. I didn't have to press any buttons though, so maybe it wasn't quite the same test as the other ladies have had done. The most annoying thing wasn't I couldn't sit all the way up or lay all the way back so it wasn't very comfortable  laying there for two hours without being able to stretch.

question: have any of u had a NST done on u??.im 40 weeks tomorrow, nd still no contractions :( kind of upset because i cant get to rest any more. My dr doesnt check for dialation&effacement till monday! i would be 40 + 4 :((
title: due date tomorrow, goingto hospital for a NST!
